By The Associated Press
The daybook is for planning purposes only and is not intended for publication or broadcast. You should verify any event you plan to cover.
Now, get up and go enjoy our beautiful Ozarks outdoors!
Video from the Ava Board of Aldermen meeting will be posted to the Douglas County Herald’s website at douglascountyherald.com.
Sheriff Chris Degase said the woman fired several shots at deputies

The Class 2 Final Four was not nice to Ava. The Lady Bears who had an incredible season had to settle for fourth place. This was Ava’s second Final Four appearance in three years. They also finished fourth in 2023. Ava fell to powerhouse Kennett 8-15; it was Kennett’s seventh top-three performance at the state…

On May 30, Susan Sinclair, 58, of Seymour, was taken into custody by the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office at Barnes Hospital in St. Louis after being medically cleared for confinement. Douglas County Deputies shot Sinclair on May 21, after she shot at deputies who were attempting to take her into custody for felony warrants for…

An Ava man has been charged after a body was found with multiple stab wounds in Douglas County during the early Friday morning, Aug. 15. The investigation is the first for the Ava Police Department in more than 20 years. Court records show that Aaron Ray Vaughan, 54, has been charged with first-degree murder, armed…
Now, get up and go enjoy our beautiful Ozarks outdoors!
The Lady Bears who had an incredible season had to settle for fourth place

The Ava R-1 School District is proud to announce it will again offer before-school care and an afterschool program for the 2025-26 school year. The program is open to all Douglas County students in preschool through eighth grade. The Bears Den program is funded by the 21st Century Community Learning Centers (CCLC) Grant and is…

A five-vehicle crash on Missouri Route 5 north of Ava resulted in one serious injury Friday afternoon, according to the Missouri State Highway Patrol. The crash occurred around 4:20 p.m. on May 30, approximately five miles north of Ava, when northbound traffic came to a stop for a vehicle turning left. A Chevrolet Silverado, driven…

Meetings are open to the public.
Deputy Jesse Three Eagles arrived at the scene of a child who had become entrapped under a bridge while swimming

Douglas County investigators said a woman was critically injured during an officer-involved shooting. The shooting happened on Wednesday around 6 p.m. Deputies attempted to arrest the woman wanted on felony charges, according to a press release from the Sheriff’s Office. Sheriff Chris Degase said the woman fired several shots at deputies. The deputies fired back,…
The Lady Bears who had an incredible season had to settle for fourth place

Fifteen-year-old Cade Dillon Ackerly of Ava has secured a spot in the 2025 U.S. National Yo-Yo Contest, set to take place June 27–29 at the Westgate Las Vegas Resort & Casino. nAckerly earned his qualification through his performance at the 2025 Pacific Northwest Regional Yo-Yo Championship, where he placed 9th in the 1A division. This…

A Douglas County deputy and an Ozark County dispatcher rescued a child Thursday that had been swept away in a culvert at a popular swimming hole. The incident happened near State Highway PP. Deputy Jesse Three Eagles arrived at the scene of a child who had become entrapped under a bridge while swimming. As rescuers…

White River Valley Electric Cooperative’s (WRVEC) annual meeting will be taking place virtually on Friday, August 22 at 10 a.m. The 86th Annual Meeting will highlight the “people behind the power.” Members will tune in to the closed-captioned meeting at WhiteRiverMeeting.com. A call-in option will also be provided for members who do not have access…
